sense.name: discover something previously unknown
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 2. The thing being uncovered in this sense was not previously known by the agent.
sense.examples: I uncovered the whole truth about my cousin. The journalist uncovered the vast scientific evidence on this subject. The researchers uncovered the vulnerability while studying the instruments.

sense.name: make something visible
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 1. In this sense, the thing being uncovered is already known to exist by the agent.
sense.examples: She uncovered the meat for dinner. He uncovered the mouthpiece to speak over the intercom. The doctor uncovered the patient's broken arm.
